title: Economy, without the drama
tagline: We measure what matters, ignore what doesn’t, and nudge growth toward something clever, clean, and actually useful.

chapters.title: Growth is uneven. Your strategy shouldn’t be.
chapters.lede: Some regions sprint. Others tie their shoes for twenty years. We chart divergence so you can make convergence happen — profitably.

chart.title: GDP per capita — selected EU economies

chapters.takeaway: Convergence is real — and incomplete. Strategy tip: aim hiring pipelines where the slope is steepest, not where the skyline is tallest.

chapters.title: Growth needs brains. (And decent Wi‑Fi)
chapters.lede: Ideas scale. Smokestacks don’t. We map R&D to growth to find places where cleverness compounds.

chart.title: R&D (% GDP) vs Real GDP growth

chapters.takeaway: Put talent where the ideas budget isn’t just a press release. High R&D ecosystems amplify skilled people — and margins.

chapters.title: Growth has limits. Math says hi.
chapters.lede: Infinite curves are cute until the planet disagrees. We look for decoupling — more value, less damage — and build hiring that supports it.
chapters.takeaway: Decoupling isn’t magic; it’s policy + technology + better choices. We prioritise sectors where output rises and footprints drop.

chapters.title: Growth is people. Borders are paperwork.
chapters.lede: Europe runs on human movement. We make it ethical, legal, and pleasantly uneventful.
chapters.takeaway: The shortest path between talent and demand is paperwork done right. We handle the dull bits so Europe keeps moving.

chapters.title: Better growth is balanced. (Yes, like a budget)
chapters.lede: More GDP with less inequality is a thing. Rare, but a thing. We aim hiring where the balance is feasible — and help make it feasible where it isn’t.

chart.title: GDP growth vs Gini (lower is fairer)

chapters.takeaway: Growth that actually lands in people’s lives is the only kind that lasts. We optimise for durable demand — not quarterly applause.
